lines.text: You're a good man, Peter.
I'm a goddam saint.
Saint's a little much.

[singing]
Hush little baby, don't you cry. When Peter gets home, I'm gonna punch him in the eye.

[reading a review of a boxing match in a hushed, storytelling way]
The champ caught Smith with a savage left hook...
What are you reading her?

[responding to Michael in same tone]
It doesn't matter what I read, it's the tone you use. She doesn't understand the words anyway, now where were we?
She did a doodle; your turn to change her.
I'll give you a thousand dollars if you'll do it.
Jack has a baby?
I realize such a concept tends to negate our belief in a benevolent God, but yes.
There's a quarter of a million dollars in heroin in the diaper pail and the new baby wipes are in the hall cabinet.
[Michael and Peter are changing Mary's diaper]
Peter, this is a girl. Should we be doing this?
How can something so small create so much of something so disgusting?
Beats the shit out of me.
Angelyne! Whew! Boy, you look different. What happened?
I'm dressed.
I love kids. Unfortunately Mr. Hathaway and I aren't able to have children. He has a low sperm count.
Some guys have all the luck.
All we have to do is feed it, it'll shut up.
I don't know what babies eat.
Soft stuff. We were babies once, for Christ's sakes, what did we eat?
I don't know, but it couldn't have been very good, I can't remember!
Feel her teeth.
What?
The druggist said you can tell how old she is by feeling her teeth.
I'm not gonna feel her teeth, YOU feel her teeth!
[Peter wets and cleans his finger, then sticks it in Mary's mouth]
I can't feel anything.
What does that mean?
It means she doesn't have any damn teeth!
Well, neither did Gabby Hayes and he was 90, so what?
I'm an architect for Christ sake, I build 50 story skyscrapers, I assemble cities of the future, I can certainly put together a goddam diaper.
Whoa, these diapers are way too big!
They're ultra absorbent! The more absorbent, the better if you ask me.
The little insect was just... Waiting for that diaper to fall off.
Where'd you put the baby powder?
Down the hall, I'll get it.
What'd you put it out there for? We're bathing her in here.
It's just down the hall!
Well, we're not bathing her in the hall, are we?
Well, maybe we should START, goddammit!
[Slams baby powder container on pool table, causing powder to pour everywhere]
You're going to clean that up.
Oh, this is disgusting. It's all over and it's... It's sticky and... We're going to need some kind of cleaning fluid to get this off.
How about after shave?
Baby take very, very much work.
Thanks for telling me that, Jan, I did not know that. What is he, an idiot savant?
Oh no, she doodled!
"Doodled". Ha ha.
Yes, doodled! What's the matter, don't babies doodle in Hungary?
There's been shit all over the place!
You mean the package burst?

[Thinking they meant the baby]
Well yes, I guess you could say that.
Well did you put the shit back?
No, we had it bronzed for posterity. What do you think we did with it?

[On the phone]
I'll bring you guys something back from Turkey. Maybe a drumstick.

[Changing Mary]
How do you put on these Goddamn things?
Figure it out for yourself, dickhead.
Oh, no! Not on the silk sheets! Not on the silk sheets!
Where is Jack?
He's in Turkey. Exactly where I'd be if my baby was in New York.
How old is your baby?

[Spreads his arms apart]
About this old.
How old is the baby?
I dunno, you want me to check her driver's license?
Feels as though she's ready for a change.
I'll do it.
Babies. All they do is eat, sleep and poop.
Where the hell have you been? This baby hasn't stopped crying! And she did a doodle.
A doodle? What's that...? Oh, forget it. I don't want to know.
Well you're gonna know, Pal, 'cause she did it.

[Finding a baby on their doorstep]
That's a baby.
I know it's a baby. What is it doing there?
It's sleeping.
Look at this
[news clipping]
, this is your friend Paul Milner! 'Don't let this happen to you!'
'Commercial Director Hospitalized After Mugging'... they're trying to intimidate us, I hate that!
I've had enough of this doo-doo!
I want to FINISH this, OK?
Michael, you're going to have to wash where the poop was.
See this? This is a hairry chest. You want one of these?
I had to go to four different stores to buy four different kids of formula. Three different kids of diapers, bottles, towels, you have no idea how much crap these kids need.

[to the baby]
Your daddy's a dead man.
Somebody leaves a baby at the door and you automatically assume it's mine? The baby doesn't look anything like me! I'm bigger... and I've got more hair!

[reads note that came with Mary]
"Dear Jack, here is our baby. I'm sorry I can't handle this right now..."

[snatches note from Peter and reads]
S-S-Sylvia?... Stratford! A year and a half... a year and a half ago. I did Taming of the Shrew; she was the Shrew! I did some of my best work in that one... got great reviews!
Jack, you're such a jerk. You're always thinking of yourself! I wanna kill you...

[holds Michael back]
Don't worry, Micheal, you won't have to. Jack, I would like to introduce you to your daughter, Mary.
But... uh... what am I supposed to do with it?
We've put our lives on hold, Jack, taking care of this kid. And now, it's your turn.
OK... ok... I'm an actor. I can do a father. Shouldn't be that hard.
Goodnight, Jack.

[as Mary begins to cry]
Wait, what's wrong with her?

[walking back to bed]
Goodnight, Jack.
[Jack, Michael, and Peter are waiting by a pay phone with Mary for the drug dealers to call. They are helping the police set a trap. The phone rings, Peter answers]
Hello!... Yeah, we got your message!... Uh uh! No good! We do it our way!... 'Cause we've got the stuff! And, if you don't do it our way...

[whispering as Peter gathers himself]
Say it, say it!
We FLUSH it down the toilet! Now, listen, there's a construction site...
